data.title: Elections: Cypriot Presidency 2018 Round 2
data.text:
Cyprus: President, 4 February 2018

At stake in this election:

The office of the President of Cyprus

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President Nikos ANASTASIADIS (since 28 February 2013)

Head of Government: President Nikos ANASTASIADIS (since 28 February 2013)

Assembly: Unicameral House of Representatives (Vouli Antiprosopon) with 80 seats

Description of electoral system:

The President is directly elected by an absolute majority popular vote in 2 rounds, if needed, for a 5-year term.

Last Election:

The last elections for the President of Cyprus were held in 2013. Nikos ANASTASIADIS was elected in the second round.

Main candidates in the election:

Nikos ANASTASIADES

Democratic Rally / Dimokratikós Sinagermós (DISY)

Stavros MALAS

Progressive Party of Working People / Anorthotikó Kómma Ergazómenou Laoú (AKEL)

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 1,221,549

Registered Voters: 543,186

Gender Data:

Female Population: 598,799

Is Cyprus a signatory to CEDAW: N/A

Has Cyprus ratified CEDAW: Yes, accession (23 July 1985)

Gender Quota: No

Female candidates in this election: No

Number of Female Parliamentarians: 10

Human Development Index Position: 33

Social Institutions and Gender Index (SIGI) Categorization: N/A

Disability Data:
